title: Class 2
content:
opening project in sublime first open sublime editor. File > open folder
boilerplate / starter tag 4  html head title body heading (h1 - h6) paragraph (p) bold / strong (b, strong) italic / emphasize (i, em) horizontal row (hr) break (br) anchor (a) image tag  basic rule Whatever we can achieve through in css, we should use css not html.
basic html boilerplate code <html> <head> <title>Document</title> </head> <body> </body> </html>  html 5 starter / boilerplate code <!DOCTYPE html> <html> <head> <meta charset="UTF-8"> <title>Document</title> </head> <body> </body> </html>  html5 doctype declaration <!DOCTYPE html>  meta tag meta tag used for supporting information
<meta charset="UTF-8">  tag, element, attribute <!-- tag --> html p hr  <!-- element --> <p>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet.</p>  <p class='hello'>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet.</p> <!-- here class is a attribute and class value is hello -->  relative path and absolute path <!-- Relative path --> <a href="about.html"></a> <!-- Absolute path --> <a href="http://google.com"></a>  Absolute path always start with http or https
anchor tag <a href="about.html"></a>  opening anchor tag in different tab by adding target='_blank' attribute we can open link in different tab.
<a href='https://google.com' target="_blank">this is google link</a>  img tag <img src="imagename.jpg" alt="if image not found">

title: class 1
content:
Command ~ - tilde means home directory
 mkdir - make directory - to create a folder touch - to create a file ls - listing - to check available file cd - change directory rm - remove file or folder cp - copy mv - move / cut pwd - present working directory  flag flag always start with hyphen -.
 a - all r - recursive f - force  Identifier  . - current folder .. - parent folder * - everything  Usages How to create a folder
mkdir <folderName>  How to open/change/go to a folder
cd <foldername>  how to create file
touch <filename>  how to know current working directory
pwd  how to copy a file
cp <location 1> <location 2>  how to move a file
mv <location 1> <location 2>  how to go back to parents folder
cd ..  how to paste content in current folder
cp <location 1> .  how to copy multiple contents or folder
cp -r <location 1> <location 2>  how to remove a file
rm <filename>  how to remove a folder
rm -r <foldername>  how to delete everything
rm -r *
